text:
Robert Dean Lee (November 26, 1937 – March 25, 2020) was an American closer and spot starter in Major League Baseball. He played from 1964 through 1968 for the Los Angeles Dodgers, California Angels, and the Cincinnati Reds. He was born in Ottumwa, Iowa.
Lee died on March 25, 2020, at his home in Lake Havasu City, Arizona at the age of 82.
